title: Verizon Unveils Advanced Network Retainer to Help Clients Keep Pace with Digital Transformation
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/28/2015 @ 9:01 AM Companies mentioned in this article: Verizon 
BASKING RIDGE, N.J., Sept. 28, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Verizon Enterprise Solutions today unveiled its Advanced Network Retainer (ANR) program aimed at helping clients keep up with expanding network demand driven by digital transformation. 
The new retainer program offers rapid access to a range of networking experts who can provide assistance tailored to meet individual client requirements. Verizon experts work with clients to better understand the client's network, identify and upgrade obsolete components, run assessments to fine-tune performance, make recommendations and create a forward-thinking strategy and roadmap that will help drive competitive advantage. 
The team also can provide hands-on implementation activities backed up by project management. 
Client engagements typically begin with Verizon's Business Outcome Advancement Workshop that's hosted for cross-functional leaders within a business. The workshop is designed to clarify and align business and technology vision with a broad spectrum of stakeholders. 
Industry experts estimate that average enterprise bandwidth demands will grow by nearly 30 percent annually, yet IT budgets remain nearly constant. 
"Our clients are finding that their networks need to move, change and adapt to ensure their business objectives are met," said Tony Turni, vice president, IT Consulting Services for Verizon Enterprise Solutions. "In order to keep up with customer demand and deliver an outstanding customer experience, enterprises are learning that it always comes back to the network." 
In fact, according to Verizon's report "Digital Transformation Powers Your Business," 67 percent of organizations say that legacy network infrastructure is a bottleneck in enterprise IT. 
Verizon's ANR is ideal for organizations affected by mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, down-sizing and the need to expand to a global infrastructure. It is also well suited for companies whose business strategies are evolving due to an intensifying competitive climate; increasing regulatory compliance mandates and organizational restructuring. 
Verizon's team consists of more than 300 professional services consultants around the globe dedicated to networking design and architecture services and specializing in SDN/hybrid networking, WLAN/Wi-Fi, 4G LTE and IPv6 adoption among other key areas. The team is supported by a dedicated sales, engineering and delivery organization to provide seamless delivery and high levels of satisfaction for clients. 
Recently named a leader worldwide in the IDC Marketscape, Worldwide Network Consulting Services 2015 Vendor Assessment,* the company was recognized for "its capability to leverage all of its assets around the globe from an enterprise and consumer perspective combined with its technology expertise to be able to understand the customer experience from both a business and technology point of view." 
Verizon Enterprise Solutions helps clients improve customer experience, drive growth and business performance and manage risk. With industry-specific solutions provided over the company's secure mobility, cloud, strategic networking, Internet of Things and advanced communications platforms, Verizon Enterprise Solutions helps open new opportunities around the world for innovation, investment and business transformation. Visit www.verizonenterprise.com to learn more. 
About Verizon Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE, Nasdaq: VZ), headquartered in New York, employs a diverse workforce of 178,500 and generated more than $127 billion in 2014 revenues. Verizon Wireless operates America's most reliable wireless network, with 109.5 million retail connections nationwide. Verizon also provides converged communications, information and entertainment services over America's most advanced fiber-optic network, and delivers integrated business solutions to customers worldwide.
